title: 1968 Mercedes-Benz 280SE Coupe W111 1968 Very Good Condition

description: Mercedes-Benz 280SE Coupe W111 1968 very good condition

For sale this 1968 Mercedes-Benz 280SE Coupe W111. Beautiful combination of paint bright silver with cognac leather interior. Car has the original wheels and lost of great chrome details. engine is the mighty 6 cylinder 2778cc attached to the 4 handshifter gearbox. This beautiful 280SE coupe is in very good condition and is very well maintained with several invoices present.

1966 Mercedes-Benz 250SEC Coupé, The specialized magazines describe this coupé as the most elegant of Mercedes-Benz. It is hand built in Sindelfingen Germany in a small serie of 5'259. At its time it has been one of the most costly cars in the world and was sold to the beautiful and rich.

This car, which has been built in 1966, is in the hands of its actual and second owner since 1967. It has received a more powerful 280 SE engine. 2009 new original Mercedes-Benz front leather seats have been mounted. 2014 it has been mechanically overhauled. In 2016 it was generally overhauled. It won a third prize in the Zurich Classic Award in 2016.
Facts:
Make: Mercedes-Benz; Type: 2 door Coupé 250 SE/C, 280 SE engine; 6 cylinder, 2746 ccm, 114 KW. Kilometers: 141'000. Gearbox: 4 speed manual; Colour: Black, interior brown leather.
It is in very good mechanical and body condition. The interior woodwork of the front panel needs refurbishing, which can be executed in Europe.

Euro-spec 4-speed 250SL, matching-numbers, lifetime California car, the notches are intact, the spot welds are mostly visible despite a thick older repaint, and this is a rare and unusual California Coupe, which has a back seat, removable hardtop, but no convertible top.

We don't know where this SL was originally delivered, but given the metric speedometer and the large B on the tail, we suspect it was perhaps Belgium. Shortly thereafter, it arrived in California, its namesake, where it spent the next 45 years. It wears its original color combination of Dark Olive paint with a black hardtop and matching black hubcaps, which makes it look understated and substantial, a look we like a great deal. It appears that it is a combination of original paint on the hood and deck, while the sides of the car have been repainted. Why, we can't say, but the color match is quite good and aside from a thin spot on the hood where it has been buffed through, it looks great. Not perfect, but if you want a casual SL that's easy to drive and offers no worries in the real world, it's ideal. The all-important notches on the front fenders are clearly visible and while the repaint seems to have been thick enough to obscure some of the spot welds on the inner fenders, they're still evident. You will also note that the usual trouble spots in the rear valence under the bumpers are clean. The Euro-spec cars offer the handsome headlights that were designed for the car, not the homely US-spec lights that were a compromise with the Feds. There's also a square fog light on the tail, another European feature, and without the US-spec overriders on the bumpers the design is extremely clean. There's just no angle from which this car doesn't look great.

We strongly believe the black leather interior is original, which speaks to the car's excellent preservation. There's some moderate wear on the driver's seat but no splits, tears, or other damage, and it appears that even the carpets are original. The door panels are excellent and the wood on top of the dash is in very good condition, needing little more than some linseed oil to buff up to a soft shine. \ All the gauges are fully operational and you'll note that the speedometer is measuring in KPH, not MPH. The Blaupunkt AM/FM/shortwave radio is an awesome addition and powers up, although we haven't tested all its functions. A glance behind the front seats and you'll see how the California coupe is different—a full-width bench seat that could probably accommodate adults for short trips but is probably best reserved for children. Better yet, it folds down to create a rather large parcel shelf which, combined with the trunk, offers quite a bit of space. And speaking of the trunk, it's neatly finished with a proper mat, along with a factory jack assembly and tool roll. The removable hardtop is in excellent condition with a clean headliner, good chrome, and good weather seals.

The car is powered by its original, numbers-matching 2.5 liter inline-6, which makes for entertaining performance in the relatively lightweight SL. Turn the key and listen for the fuel pumps to pressurize the system, then kick the starter and let it fire up and idle on its own. After a second or two, it settles into an even 700 RPM idle and is ready to run. No noises, no smoke, and good oil pressure suggest the robust Mercedes-Benz engine is healthy and it pulls with genuine enthusiasm at almost any speed. It's tidy under the hood, with mostly original finishes used throughout, correct fittings, and factory-style hardware. Recent work includes a new master cylinder, correct Bosch coil and distributor cap, as well as new plugs and wires.

The desirable 4-speed manual transmission transforms the SL from pleasant little convertible to aggressive-feeling roadster. Clutch action is light and while the shifter is a bit vague, you won't miss a gear and it feels familiar right from the start. Somewhat tall 3.92 gears in the independent rear end make it feel punchy around town and the six doesn't mind spinning along at modern highway speeds. There's a recent exhaust system that gives it that characteristic six-cylinder baritone wail and with both power steering and power brakes, it's easy for anyone to handle. In addition to the master cylinder, the brake hoses, calipers, and pads are new, and there are fresh shocks at all four corners. The floors, rockers, and other critical areas show their California heritage with exactly zero issues—that's factory undercoating on the floors, not rust or scale. This is a very solid SL. Factory 14-inch steel wheels with color-matched hubcaps carry new 195/75/14 radials.

We've sold a lot of SLs, and we like this one most of all. It isn't the nicest, the most perfect, or the most valuable, but it drives quite well and the 4-speed completely transforms the Pagoda's personality. If you can live without the folding soft top (which isn't hard), it represents a lot of Mercedes-Benz quality and an awesome pedigree for the money. Call today!
For more details and photos, please visit www.HarwoodMotors.com

Single family owner since it was picked up at the factory in Stutgart by my father.  In California the entire time except for a few years while I was in New York and Pennsylvania for my education.  Always in a garage and maintained professionally.  In excellent running order.  Original engine and transmission.  Bimetalic fan has been upgraded to fixed so there is no overheating.  Suspension overhaul in 2012.  No rust.
Very unique factory installed child's seat with aftermarket seatbelt.  Soft-top was replaced and is in good condition.  Hard top in excellent condition.

European Motor Studio is very proud to offer without a doubt one of the finest 114 bodied 250 Sedans on the planet. This 1971 Mercedes-Benz 250 Sedan finished in Tobacco Brown over Cognac has recently undergone a full nut and bolt restoration to an incredibly high standard. After leaving the Mercedes-Benz Stuttgart factory in August of 1970, this 250 was then sent to Long Beach California where it sold new. The high quality Tobacco Brown finish is exceptional. The whole car was completely disassembled and stripped and painted in factory correct Tobacco Brown All of the body seals were replaced, all of the chrome was sent out and re-plated and the entire engine, transmission, suspension, brakes and steering components were all replaced or rebuilt with full powder coating and zinc plating. The engine bay and undercarriage is beautifully detailed and very authentic with keeping to correct factory standards. The interior looks absolutely fantastic and looks like it could have rolled out of the showroom floor. The wood in just about perfect and there is not a mark on any of the seats. The carpets are all just about new and there is not a mark on the dash top or center console. There is no cracking in the steering wheel and all of the switchgear looks just about new. Everything on the car works down to the original Becker radio with power antenna and the original factory AC blows cold along with a proper working heater. The dashboard dials are working correctly unlike most Mercedes of this vintage. All of the gauges are reading correctly and are crystal clear with no fade or hazing. This is a stunning example to run and drive. The engine idles smoothly and runs through the gears with ease. The transmission shifts as it should and the engine pulls strong. The ride is nice and tight but smooth at cruising speed. All of the exterior lights are working as they should including all turn signals, brake and reverse lights. There is absolutely no rust to be found on this 250. The body is arrow straight and the undercarriage is exceptional. This is an incredible opportunity to acquire one of the best examples of a Mercedes-Benz 114 chassis in existence. Accompanied with the sale of this car are service documents, original factory owners handbooks, service books, dealer books, the car care book, the Becker radio books and brochure, original wiring diagram and the parts books. There are two original keys, the original spare tire and tool kit along with the original jack.

One of the finest original Pagoda examples on the market anywhere.  Stored in a garage on the West Coast it's entire life, rarely driven, always serviced and kept up. 1969 Mercedes 280SL / Dark Olive 291
This 280SL is on consignment at Bud's Benz in Douglasville.
Our customer, who I'm assisting with the sale, gave me all this information.
*Purchased in 1992 from The Stable in Gladstone NJ.
*The car has been continuosly garaged since then.
*All service receipts and the 2015 minor restoration project are available, and will go with the car (when it sales).
*Engine and body numbers match (Eng 130.983.12.006668)
*Body numbers are 3166
*This SL is an Automatic, floor shift style.
*The car has power steering.
*The radio is a Becker Europa II 467, and the car has the original clock.
*The SL has both tops (hardtop and softtop), and both are in very good servicable condition.
*The interior is Cognac MB Tex vinyl. The seats and dash material are in very good condition. The coachwork overall is in very good condition.
*The engine and trunk compartment is clean and rust free. The engine bay area (inner fenders) still retain the original spot welds.
*The spot welds on the rear lower body panel are also present.
**In 2015, the following was done to the SL:
-Paint job. Paint was removed, and light body work done to this car. The car was pin striped. The hardtop was also repainted. The paint on this car looks great!
-All chrome on the exterior was removed, cleaned, polished, and or replated (including hubcaps)
-All body rubber seals (door, trunk, window, lights, side body lights, and door trim) replaced
-Replaced windshield and rubber seal
-New door panel skins were installed, and panels on the back wall were recovered. The convertible hatch lid was also recovered.
-The dashwood on the dash was replaced
The car drives great. I've included as many pictures as I can list for this car.
The car is in great condition mechanically, body, and interior.
This is a car that is worth taking a look at.
If I can help or answer any other questions, please let me know....Thanks, David

is in excellent condition. This car has been maintained by a master technician. The 250SL runs excellent, has no rust and has original paint. This car has been purchased from the original owner. This car comes with a hard top, canvas soft top and a rack to store the hard top.

Gateway Classic Cars of Fort Lauderdale is proud to present this highly collectible 1970 Mercedes-Benz 280SL Pagoda. This numbers matching car is the perfect cruiser. Also called the W113 this car took on the Pagoda name for the unusual shape of its hardtop. This Mercedes has just 56472 actual miles! The car underwent a complete mechanical and interior restoration between 2010 and 2012.This 280SL is powered by its original M130 fuel injected inline 6. This motor was rebuilt just 1200 miles ago. The motor is mated to the original 4-speed manual that shifts beautifully. Driving this classic is an absolute blast. This gorgeous classic is begging to be taken out of the garage and onto the open road. It has a sporty feel to it but is still a comfortable ride. Power steering and power brakes add to the pleasurable driving experience. This fine example"??s white paint is in terrific condition. The blue leather interior looks excellent against the white exterior and the interior restoration really shows well. This W113 comes with both a soft top and a hard top.Features on this 280SL Pagoda AM/FM radio CD player convertible soft and hard tops a spare tire hubcaps power steering powder brakes a jack seat belts and radial tires.Values of these 280SL"??s have been increasing quickly.
